data.title: updated the AddIn to support the MonoDevelop 3.0
Update Rectangle.Intersects to correct off-by-one error
Fix AudioSession crash introduced with iOS 5.1.
data.body: iOS 5.1 emulator crashes when setting the Category to SoloAmbientSound.  I added a try/catch which seems like the best solution for now.  Crash does not occur on actual hardware.  Could be a MonoTouch bug I suppose, but seems unlikely.

data.title: Various fixes to get Linux compiling and working with latest sample project
Develop3d- Update Android project for MfA 4.2
data.body:
Update changed enums and ints to enums.
Remove AndroidApplication tag from MonoGame.Framework.Android.csproj.
Comment out calls to Activity.SetRequiredOrientation as it has been removed.

Due to a change in MfA, applications now need to explicitly reference all used assemblies, in this case Lidgren.  They will change it back to implicit reference like it was previously (and all other .NET environments are) in a future update.

Added changes for Android to support MediaQueue.

data.title: Develop3d - Get PSS Compiling again and split PSS SpriteBatcher off
data.body:
This PR includes changes to get PSS Compiling again and includes a PSS specific SpriteBatcher implementation.
This is split from the standard one due to the difference in layout and implementation required to get decent performance on PSS by minimizing VertexBuffer uploads.

There are some parts of the PSS SpriteBatcher that are straight copy/paste from the standard one. I'm happy to do any tidy up suggested to make them share more code so long as it doesn't lower performance (PSS is really slow).

It may be worth trying a similar SpriteBatcher optimisation on iOS/Android if anyone feels like trying it out. (Doing a single VBO upload and multiple DrawElements(?) calls)

data.title: iOS Music and Sound
data.body:
This update adds MGSoundEffectProcessor and MGSongProcessor and runtime code for both.

SoundEffect is passed to iOS uncompressed as per-Apple recommendations for now.  We're looking to add mp3 compressed sound effects with CPU decoding at load time in a later update.

Songs are passed as compressed MP3s and played using the iOS streaming music api.

There are also a few other misc fixes in this build.

Ray will be updating the wiki with how this all works and will link the doc here.

data.title: Updated the API to use the Mono for Android 4.2 Enumerations
data.body: Fixed a problem with the MonoGame Templates

data.title: Develop3d- Almost halved Android content load times
data.body:
Almost halved Android content load times by reading the entire XNB into a MemoryStream first. Android asset streams are quite slow when reading many small values.
Threaded loading works again on Android.

data.title: PSSuite SpriteBatcher Fixes / Performance Improvements
data.body:
Fix up all the numbers in PSSuite SpriteBatcher so that you can render more than 1 sprite correctly!
Only read the TouchPad once per main loop rather than once per Update otherwise the device waits a VSYNC for new data before continuing which makes everything a lot slower.

PSSuite is still terribly terribly slow.

data.title: DX11 Rendering and MGFX Improvements
data.body:
In this pull...
- DX11 rendering fully works... added ScissorRect, DrawUserPrimitive, and correct dynamic VB/IB support.
- Fixed some dumb DX11 rendering bugs.
- GL path now uses ConstantBuffer objects like DX11 (sort of faked via Mojoshader uniform arrays).
- Added "state key" system for EffectParametersâ€¦ the constant buffers are only updated if a parameter really changes.
- Fixed scissor rect on GL... it was flipped.
- MGFX now stores parameter indicies removing the string dictionary lookups when updating constant buffers.

Now that rendering in DX11 fully works, i'm gonna look at adding the textual format into MGFX and doing Graphics improvements and cleanups.

data.title: A few small PSSuite Fixes
data.body:
TouchPanel is implemented (not tested on a real device but I think it will work, works with mouse on the emulator).
TitleContainer.OpenStream opens files from the right location.
Calling Game.Quit() actually quits.

data.title: Enough changes to get PSS SpriteBatch working
data.body:
This pull request implements a PSS version of SpriteBatcher using the PSS VertexBuffer.
This should be enough to get some basic samples going, which I'll play with later :-)

data.title: iOS Pinch and Orientation
data.body:
Implementation of the pinch gesture for iOS.
Fixed landscape orientations on iOS.

data.title: Develop3d - Fix null reference exception in effects other than BasicEffect
data.body: Shader index is no longer a shader parameter.  Fixes null reference exception.

data.title: Added Missing file, ConstantBuffer, to MacOS project.
iOS Fixes
data.body: A few small issues we missed in our last pull.

data.title: Move AudioSession.Initialize call before Alc.OpenDevice call
data.body:
Otherwise it is to late to set the audio session to ambient.  According
to Apple guidelines if other music is playing it should continue playing
and be mixed with your game sounds.  The previous fix did not let that
happen.

data.title: Win8 DX11
data.body:
So this pull contains fixes to make most of the graphics systems work for DX11.  The known issues at this moment...

```
- DrawUserPrimitive needs implementing.
- Scissor Rects need implementing.
- DynamicVertexBuffer is currently faked with a slow non-dynamic VB.
- Some GraphicsResource disposal fixes.
- GraphicsDevice initialization order is possibly incorrect.
```

Our game as well as many of the XNA samples will run with these changes.

My next pass will address the issue above and do some MGFX cleanup further unifying the DX11 and GLSL paths.

data.title: Develop3d - Adds gesture support using WinRT gestures.
data.body:
WinRT provides a comprehensive gesture recognizer that provides nearly everything we need.

Pinch in XNA provides positions and deltas of both touch locations. WinRT only provides the centre position and change in distance between the two touch locations for the pinch gesture.  I am placing the centre position in GestureSample.Position and GestureSample.Delta is Vector2(Expansion, 0).  Position2 and Delta2 are set to zero.

If this is not suitable, we may have to port the iOS gesture code and see if that works better.

data.title: Fix for AudioSession initialize and additional TypeReader
data.body:
The recent change to allow ambient sound to play wasn't quite right. First the initialize needs to be done before the Alc.Open.  Second we need to use the AmbientSound instead of SoloAmbientSound to allow background audio to continue playing if it is when the app starts.
The other change is adding Rectangle[] to the list of pre-loaded TypeReaders.  This could get ugly have everyone add their required TypeReaders to this list.

data.title: AudioSession throwing exception on load
data.body:
I ran into this a couple weeks ago, and forgot to create an issue. there was a recent change to MonoGame.Framework/MacOS/Audio/OpenALSoundController.cs thats throws an exception on application load. It occurs in this block:

AudioSession.Initialize();
AudioSession.Category = AudioSessionCategory.SoloAmbientSound; // thrown on this line

AudioSession.Interrupted += (sender, e) => Alc.MakeContextCurrent(ContextHandle.Zero);
AudioSession.Resumed+= (sender, e) => Alc.MakeContextCurrent(_context); 

Here's the stack trace from my app.

  at MonoTouch.AudioToolbox.AudioSession.SetInt (AudioSessionProperty property, Int32 val) [0x00015] in /Developer/MonoTouch/Source/monotouch/src/shared/AudioToolbox/AudioSession.cs:253 
  at MonoTouch.AudioToolbox.AudioSession.set_Category (AudioSessionCategory value) [0x00000] in /Developer/MonoTouch/Source/monotouch/src/shared/AudioToolbox/AudioSession.cs:289 
  at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Audio.OpenALSoundController..ctor () [0x000ff] in /MyApp/MonoGame/MonoGame.Framework/MacOS/Audio/OpenALSoundController.cs:63 
  at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Audio.OpenALSoundController.get_GetInstance () [0x0000a] in /MyApp/MonoGame/MonoGame.Framework/MacOS/Audio/OpenALSoundController.cs:73 
  at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.iOSGamePlatform..ctor (Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Game game) [0x00024] in MyApp/MonoGame/MonoGame.Framework/iOS/iOSGamePlatform.cs:99 
  at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.GamePlatform.Create (Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Game game) [0x00000] in /MyApp/MonoGame/MonoGame.Framework/GamePlatform.cs:84 
  at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Game..ctor () [0x001fe] in /MyApp/MonoGame/MonoGame.Framework/Game.cs:129 
  at MyApp..ctor () [0x00000] in <filename unknown>:0 
  at MyApp.Application.FinishedLaunching (MonoTouch.UIKit.UIApplication app) [0x00000] in /MyApp/Program.cs:50 //
  at (wrapper managed-to-native) MonoTouch.UIKit.UIApplication:UIApplicationMain (int,string[],intptr,intptr)
  at MonoTouch.UIKit.UIApplication.Main (System.String[] args, System.String principalClassName, System.String delegateClassName) [0x00042] in /Developer/MonoTouch/Source/monotouch/src/UIKit/UIApplication.cs:29 
  at MyApp.Application.Main (System.String[] args) [0x00000] in /MyApp/Program.cs:61 

Sounds worked in my app before this addition, so to resolve for my app, i comment that block out and everything went back to normal.

data.title: MGTextureProcessor
data.body:
So this pull has the new MGTextureProcessor for getting PVRTC compressed textures for iOS along with overloaded MGMaterialProcessor and MGSpriteFontDescriptionProcessor classes which redirect TextureProcessor calls to MGTextureProcessor.

These processors extend their MS XNA counterparts providing additional features... in this case the ability to generate PVRTC textures if your building content for iOS.

These processors are meant to be used instead of XNA's processors in your project... if you're not building for iOS then things fall thru to the default behavior.

Ray is writing up a wiki page on how these are built and used now...  i'll link it here when its done.

Note that this commit also disables reading of DXT textures on iOSâ€¦ you have to use the new processors.

A performance example... our texture heavy game when from taking 116 seconds to load on an iPhone 4 to 50 seconds.  Our texture memory usage was easily reduced by 6X vs using all uncompressed textures.

data.title: SetRenderTarget saves Viewport when switching from Back Buffer
data.body:
If `SetRenderTarget` was called in `GraphicsDevice`, it would overwrite `Viewport` (even if nothing was drawn). After switching back to the Back Buffer, it did not restore the original Viewport. This gave the impression that everything was drawn relative to a bottom-right origin after each window resize, which differs from XNA output.

This patch re-enables the `savedViewport` variable (previously removed) and the behaviour now matches XNA  (and the `develop` branch) during window `OnResize` events.

---

Comments in the code suggest that there might have been broader plans for `renderTarget` management, so this might not be the preferred solution.

data.title: Implement enough of PSS that you can call GraphicsDevice.Clear and it happens!
Fixed inconsistent line endings.
data.body: A bunch of the source files in the repository have inconsistent line endings. This commit corrects that.

data.title: Resolve data type for Window in Linux / Windows
data.body: This minor patch changes the data type of the `Window` property in `GamePlatform` from `GameWindow` to `OpenTKGameWindow` for Linux and Windows builds (using preprocessors, similar to the Android implementation). It resolves the event handler issue #439.

data.title: Develop3d - Added touch, mouse and stylus input for Metro
data.body:
Uses pointer events from CoreWindow.  Replaces previous mouse input in Desktop/Input/Mouse.cs.

Desktop/Input/Mouse.cs is no longer used. Uses Input/Mouse.cs as MouseState is updated from MetroGameWindow.

data.title: Small Win8 Fixes
data.body:
Just a few fixes to help SlyGamer and anyone else along.

More coming tomorrow!

data.title: VS 11 Project Templates
data.body:
Added some initial Visual Studio 11 project templates for MonoGame, including a Metro style application template. 

You can try it out by:
- Adding the contents of the VS2012MGWindowsMetroTemplate folder to a zip archive
- Placing the zip file in the "[User Folder]\Documents\Visual Studio 11\Templates\ProjectTemplates\Visual C#\Windows Metro style\1033" folder
- Restarting VS 11
